question: 吸う
userAnswer: to{} breathe-in | smoke | suck/sip/slurp | absorb/soak-up | kiss
activeAnswer: to{} breathe-in | smoke | suck/sip/slurp | absorb/soak-up | kiss
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>suck</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to suck</vocabulary>, but it's usually used to talk about what you do to cigarettes, so a better translation I think is <vocabulary>to smoke</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: You smoke too much, and that gives you cancer. You decide to <reading>sue</reading> (<ja>す</ja>) the cigarette makers.
